intro: Tauschia biennis, commonly known as the common tawny daisy, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and ragworts. The plant features showy yellow flowers with white ray florets, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it often grows in dry, sandy soils. Tauschia biennis is a short-lived perennial that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
